titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Homer Jackson Dana Catalog and Brochure Collection 1915-1950
Dana, (Homer Jackson) Catalog and Brochure Collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Cheryl Gunselman.

repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Homer Jackson Dana Catalog and Brochure Collection
did.abstract: This collection consists of ephemeral materials collected by WSU Professor Homer Jackson Dana.

bioghist.p: Homer Jackson Dana attended the State College of Washington (now Washington State University) where he completed a bachelor's degree in electrical engineering in 1915 and a master's degree in 1917. He remained at WSU as an instructor, then returned as a student to complete a second master's degree in mechanical engineering. He continued his association with WSU, first as a consulting engineer, and later as a research engineer until his retirement in 1960. Although his post was as a research engineer, Dana occasionally taught classes, participated in the education of graduate students, and served as director of the Engineering Experiment Station.

Dana's interest in engineering led to a series of experimental projects, including researching the effect of heavy automobile traffic on roads and highways, solving refrigeration and heat transfer and storage problems, and designing the Mason City Project to measure the amount of electricity a community consumed. He was awarded patents for multiple devices, including an emotional stress meter (lie detector) and a prototype home freezer. Together with Hubert V. Carpenter, he founded one of the first educational radio stations in the United States in 1922. The radio station, located in Pullman, WA, was originally named KFAE, becoming KWSC in 1926, and KWSU in 1969.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of ephemeral materials collected by Homer Jackson Dana. It includes brochures, pamphlets, and catalogs for Automobiles 1915-1950 (Series 1), Tractors 1915-1919 (Series 2), Engines 1915-1918 (Series 3), Parts and Equipment 1915-1922 (Series 4), Appliances, Electric Lighting, and Miscellaneous 1915-1921 (Series 5) which includes operating manuals, parts lists, and other materials documenting mechanical and electrical technology.

arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in 5 series. Each series is arranged alphabetically by manufacturer or company name; in some cases, miscellaneous items are placed at the end of each series.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Homer Jackson Dana Catalog and Brochure Collection, 1915-1950 (Cage 88)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: Homer Jackson Dana donated this collection to the Washington State University Libraries at an unknown date.

processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Morgan Clendenning.

relatedmaterial.p: A Historical Sketch Describing the Growth of the Generation and Use of Electricity in Pullman and the Inland Empire Typescrypt, 1958 February 11 (Cage 1817) (Cage 1817)

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
